business.headline: Lower auto tariffs, wider market access: What the India-EU trade deal may look likeIndia-European Union trade negotiations have reached a decisive stage, with New Delhi offering major tariff cuts on European cars and both sides signalling readiness to seal a politically significant deal that could reshape trade, investment and supply chains.
India plans to cut EU car tariffs to 40% from 110% ahead of trade deal: ReportThe anticipated tariff cuts would substantially ease access to the Indian market for Volkswagen, Mercedes-Benz and BMW.

IndiGo cancels flights to Tbilisi, Tashkent, Baku till Jan 28 amid Iran tensionsIn view of the prevailing situation and after careful assessment, IndiGo said it was cancelling flights to and from Tbilisi (Georgia), Almaty (Kazakhstan), Tashkent (Uzbekistan) and Baku (Azerbaijan) on January 26, 27 and 28.

India, EU mega trade deal near finish line with phased tariff cuts: Maros SefcovicAutomobiles have long been one of the toughest chapters in the India–EU free trade negotiations. European carmakers have sought lower import duties and clearer rules to expand their footprint in India, while New Delhi has remained cautious, wary of exposing domestic manufacturers to sudden competition.

India set to become 3rd-largest economy, but why is per capita income still low?Every time India moves up the global GDP ranks, the per capita income question resurfaces. Looking at both together shows a truer picture than letting one overshadow the other.

Explained: Why EU leaders' India visit matters for the mega trade dealBy linking one of the world's fastest-growing major economies with a bloc that remains a central pillar of global trade, the deal would reshape supply-chain flows at a time when governments are rethinking their economic dependencies.

IndiGo's 10% flight curbs kick in, Centre redistributes slots to airlinesIndia's aviation sector is witnessing a strategic reshuffle as the government redistributes 10 per cent of IndiGo's flight operations to other domestic carriers. This phased approach aims to balance capacity while ensuring passenger convenience and connectivity.

Why most Indians are still underinsured despite buying insuranceSeveral insurer-backed studies show that a large share of Indian policyholders have life cover of less than five times their annual income. Most financial planners recommend at least 10 to 15 times annual income, and often more.

Will AI kill jobs across the globe and how can India ride the AI wave? Experts weigh inIn this India Today special show from the World Economic Forum in Davos, top artificial intelligence innovators share their perspectives on the global AI race, AI's impact on the Indian economy and much more.

From income protection to easier credit: What gig workers expect from Budget 2026Delivery partners, drivers and freelancers form the backbone of India's fast-growing gig economy, yet financial security remains fragile for many. As Budget 2026 approaches, gig workers are hoping for measures that offer income protection, smoother credit access and faster support during emergencies.

Gold shines at record highs: What should investors do now?With gold touching new lifetime highs, the metal has once again proved its role as a refuge in uncertain times. But for investors, the rally raises a key question: what is the right move at current levels? Let's have a look.

Are personal loans becoming the go-to option during medical emergencies?A sudden medical emergency can quickly turn into a financial crisis. With healthcare costs rising and insurance cover often falling short, many Indian families are increasingly turning to personal loans to bridge the gap.

Sensex sinks 770 points, Nifty tumbles as FII selling hits sentiment hardMarkets slipped sharply as foreign investor selling, sector-wide pressure and a weakening rupee crushed sentiment. With Nifty near a key support zone, the next few sessions could set the tone for February.

Sensex down nearly 800 points at closing: Why stock market fell todayAt the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 769.67 points at 81,537.70 and the NSE Nifty50 slipped 241.25 points to 25,048.65.

Sebi accuses PwC and EY executives in Yes Bank's 2022 share sale: ReportIn total, 19 individuals have been accused of insider trading violations. Seven are alleged to have traded using privileged information, while four are accused of sharing it.

Can Budget 2026 help make insurance more affordable for Indians?With healthcare costs rising and insurance still out of reach for many, Budget 2026 is being closely watched by households and insurers alike. Industry leaders believe the right tax and policy moves could make insurance more affordable for millions.

French President's viral Davos shades give iVision Tech a 38 crore stock boostFrench President Emmanuel Macron's look during his World Economic Forum speech went viral online and the market reacted instantly.

From easier credit to insurance: What MSMEs want from Union Budget 2026As the Union Budget 2026 approaches, MSMEs are looking for practical support to ease everyday financial pressures. Industry leaders say better access to credit, lower insurance costs and simpler rules could help small businesses grow with confidence.

Is Rs 50,000 salary enough to invest? Sebi advisor explains what actually worksFinancial advisors say this income level is enough to begin building a long-term portfolio, provided the focus remains on discipline, safety and clear financial goals.

IndiGo share price down 4% after Q3 results: Buy, sell or hold?IndiGo share price: The stock slipped as much as 3.9% during early trade to hit an intraday low of Rs 4,723.60. It later recovered part of the losses but continued to trade in the red.

entertainment.headline: Scale is so big: Border 2 director Anurag Singh on challenge of shooting the film Director Anurag Singh revealed the massive scale and technical challenges behind Border 2, which was largely shot on real locations to maintain authenticity.

Akshaye Khanna's Border 2 cameo was in script before Dhurandhar: Bhushan Kumar Producer Bhushan Kumar opened up on Akshaye Khanna's de-aged cameo in Border 2. He revealed about the scene being scripted much before Dhurandhar's success.

Vijay Sethupathi shares why he became an actor, leaves Kapil Sharma in splits Vijay Sethupathi left Kapil Sharma in splits on The Great Indian Kapil Show with his honest reason for becoming an actor, as seen in a leaked promo.

Cha Eun-woo apologises for tax evasion row involving his mother's company Cha Eun-woo issued a personal apology regarding tax evasion allegations involving a shell company established by his mother. The actor expressed deep regret for disappointing fans and pledged to cooperate fully with all future tax-related legal procedures.

MM Keeravani's Vande Mataram prioritises ceremonial scale over emotional movement Unveiled at the Republic Day parade amid grand visuals and mass choreography, Vande Mataram received a new musical treatment by Oscar-winning composer M. M. Keeravani.

Republic Day 2026 fulfills Rishi Kapoor's dream to represent Indian cinema at event Indian cinema received a historic honour at the 77th Republic Day parade with a dedicated tableau, fulfilling late actor Rishi Kapoor's 2020 suggestion. Curated by Sanjay Leela Bhansali, the 'Bharat Gatha' tableau celebrated the cultural and global impact of Indian films.

Varun Dhawan broke image in this film: Border 2 co-actor Paramvir Cheema Paramvir Singh Cheema discussed the challenges of acting in Border 2 alongside legends and handling online trolling. He emphasises the film's message of unity and secularism amid social media controversies.

Waheeda Rahman says AR Rahman might be getting less work due to age, not religion Waheeda Rehman reacted to AR Rahman's comments about communal bias in Bollywood. She also reflected on the reason behind the singer-composer getting less work.

Mohanlal announces new film with director Vishnu Mohan, tentatively titled L367 Veteran Malayalam actor Mohanlal announced his upcoming collaboration with director Vishnu Mohan, tentatively titled L367. He will next be seen in the highly anticipated Jeetu Joseph film Drishyam 3.

Prakash Raj says Hindi films look plastic like Madame Tussauds, backs South cinema At the Kerala Literature Festival, actor Prakash Raj compared Hindi cinema to a 'Madame Tussauds museum,' stating it has become 'fake' and 'money-oriented.' He even praised Malayalam and Tamil cinema for their strong storytelling.
Was bored out of my skull: Sayani Gupta on leaving high-paying job for acting Sayani Gupta shared how her mother initially opposed her decision to quit a high-paying corporate job to pursue acting.

Deeply encouraging: Laalo director Ankit Sakhiya on meeting Karan Johar Karan Johar met director Ankit Sakhiya after the historic success of Laalo - Krishna Sada Sahaayate. The debutant director expressed gratitude on social media.

Patriot: Mammootty and Mohanlal's film to release in April. Check date here Director Mahesh Narayanan's upcoming Malayalam thriller Patriot, starring Mammootty and Mohanlal, is set for a global release in April 2026. Mohanlal shared the announcement with a special poster on Republic Day.

Esha Deol's Republic Day post honours Dharmendra, praises Sunny in Border 2 Esha Deol marked Republic Day by celebrating her late father Dharmendra's Padma Vibhushan honour and praising brother Sunny Deol after watching Border 2 together.

Atlee on Jawan 2, collaborating with Shah Rukh Khan: Don 3 was just a rumour In a recent interview, Atlee addressed rumours about collaborating with Shah Rukh Khan on 'Jawan 2' and 'Don 3.' The filmmaker hinted that the two might collaborate but not on these projects.

Disha Patani and Talwiinder hold hands at Lollapalooza in new video. Watch Disha Patani and singer Talwiinder were seen walking hand-in-hand in new video from Lollapalooza event in Mumbai. The viral clip has once again fuelled romance rumours.

Who is Nadeem Khan? All about Dhurandhar actor arrested in rape case Actor Nadeem Khan, who was seen in the blockbuster 'Dhurandhar', has been arrested for allegedly raping a domestic worker over nearly ten years under the false promise of marriage.

Lokesh Kanagaraj breaks silence on Thalaivar 173 exit, Kaithi 2 delay Director Lokesh Kanagaraj addressed speculations about him taking a step back from Rajinikanth and Kamal Haasan's Thalaivar 173, explaining the real reasons behind his decision.

Chiranjeevi denies casting couch culture, social media reacts sharply Actor Chiranjeevi has weighed in on the long-standing casting couch debate, stating that the Telugu film industry does not have a culture of exploitation, triggering mixed reactions online.

general news.headline: BJP claims Rahul Gandhi didn't wear north-east patka despite President's requestsBJP's Information and Technology (IT) chief Amit Malviya even claimed on X that Rahul Gandhi didn't oblige even after President Droupadi Murmu reminded him twice in the 'At Home Reception' at Rashtrapati Bhavan.

Canada's PM likely to visit India in March as Trump tariffs rattle trade orderCanadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is likely to visit India in early March with agreements expected on energy, critical minerals and emerging technologies, reported news agency Reuters. This comes as both countries move to reset ties and diversify trade amid global uncertainty and stalled negotiations.

Xi's top general accused of leaking China's nuke secrets to USThe allegations include leaking "core technical data" from China's nuclear weapons programme to the United States. The report cites people familiar with a high-level internal briefing for senior Chinese military officers, which took place shortly before the public announcement of the investigation, reported The Wall Street Journal.

Pakistan delay final call on T20 World Cup participation after PCB chief meets Pak PMThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has delayed a final decision on the country's participation in the T20 World Cup after chairman Mohsin Naqvi met Prime Minister Muhammad Shehbaz Sharif.

PM Modi shares glimpses of spectacular Republic Day celebration at Kartavya PathPrime Minister Narendra Modi highlighted the 77th Republic Day parade as a proud showcase of India's security strength, cultural diversity and growing ties with the European Union. The celebrations reflected the nation's unity, democratic values and expanding international partnerships.

Trump hails 'historic bond' with India on Republic Day amid trade strainsDespite ongoing trade disputes and policy differences, the United States and India continue to uphold a historic partnership, as highlighted by US leaders on India's 77th Republic Day. The celebrations underscored the enduring strategic and democratic ties between the two nations.

UAE drops Pak airport project days after President Nahyan's India visitDespite initial interest shown by the UAE, it failed to name a local partner for outsourcing the management and operations of Islamabad International Airport, indicating disinterest on Abu Dhabi's part.

Renault Duster launch live: Features, engines, price and everything you need to knowNew Renault Duster launch live updates: Renault India is all set to reintroduce the Duster in India, marking the brand's return to the competitive mids-size SUV segment with fresh design, technology and powertrains.

Why nihilist penguin's 'death march' feels uncomfortably relatableHandcrafted ByOur Editors Meet the nihilist penguin: the little bird that broke ranks, walked away from the colony, and stole the internet's heart without saying a word. In a world obsessed with productivity, connection, and "having a plan," this penguin did the unthinkable: it just left. But why has a penguin's quiet departure resonated so widely?

Amazon might lay off around 16000 employees on January 27Amazon is reportedly preparing for a fresh round of layoffs, with around 16,000 employees expected to lose their jobs starting January 27. According to reports, the impending job cuts are expected to impact Indian teams as well, including key divisions such as Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Prime Video.

Successful India makes world stable: EU chief ahead of landmark trade dealEuropean Commission President Ursula von der Leyen's Republic Day visit came as India and Brussels push to seal a long-pending trade pact, with New Delhi signalling major tariff cuts on European car imports.

Vance, Trump stalled India trade talks: US Senator's viral audio amid tariff rowLeaked audio of Senator Ted Cruz reveals internal Trump administration rifts, with JD Vance, Peter Navarro and sometimes President Trump blamed for stalling the long-pending India-US trade deal.

MM Keeravani's Vande Mataram prioritises ceremonial scale over emotional movementUnveiled at the Republic Day parade amid grand visuals and mass choreography, Vande Mataram received a new musical treatment by Oscar-winning composer M. M. Keeravani.
University of Bath School of Management announces up to £3 million in scholarships, empowering future global leadersStrategic Scholarship Investment Aimed at Attracting Exceptional Talent Worldwide

Iran warns of 'regret‑inducing' response as nuke‑powered US warship moves closerSince early January, the United States has deployed significant military assets to the Middle East, approaching Iranian waters, sending flutters through Tehran's power corridors after mass protests over inflation and a collapsing currency left at least 5,000 dead in the country.

Japanese singer Fujii Kaze on India debut, inspiration from Hindu spiritualityJapanese singer Fujii Kaze speaks to India Today about spirituality, his album Prema, and India as his spiritual home. He also opens up about his Lollapalooza Mumbai debut and creative journey.

1965: When Republic Day became a morning of mourning in MadrasOn January 26, 1965, Republic Day turned to mourning in Madras as students rioted against Hindi imposition, sparking self-immolations, deaths, and a crisis that scripted India's language policy.

Miami University: A Top U.S. Destination for Future Tech and Engineering LeadersMiami University Expands Opportunities for International Students Through Industry-Integrated Computer Science & Engineering Programs

Infosys is now tracking how much power WFH staff use at homeInfosys has reportedly asked employees following its hybrid work policy to share details of their home electricity usage, as the company looks to better measure its overall environmental footprint.

North India prepares for another round of rain, hail and snowIn Delhi-NCR, the weather is expected to remain poor from morning till afternoon on January 27, with rain accompanied by thunder, lightning, and winds of around 40 kmph. This spell may lead to a temporary drop in temperatures, adding to the winter chill.

When a little girl's flag fell, a Rapido driver lifted the spirit of Republic DayA viral video featuring a Rapido auto driver returning the national flag to a child during the Republic Day celebrations has gone viral.

One man vs 101 storey-skyscraper: Alex Honnold's heart-stopping feat. WatchAlex Honnold began his ascent up one corner of the 508-metre tower, relying on narrow L-shaped outcroppings and ornamental ledges as footholds. Unlike his usual climbs in remote wilderness, this one unfolded in the middle of a bustling city, with cheers rising from street level as he moved steadily upward.

Xi Jinping calls for 'dragon and elephant' unity in Republic Day message to IndiaOn India's Republic Day, Chinese President Xi Jinping said that China views the relationship as one in which both sides "help each other succeed," and emphasised the value of the "dragon and the elephant dancing together," which he described as the appropriate path for both countries.

After ICC warning, Pakistan consider forfeiting India game at T20 World Cup: ReportT20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan are reportedly weighing its options to protest against the ICC, which includes forfeiting its game against India. This comes after the ICC's decision to not change the venues of Bangladesh's fixtures in the tournament.

sports.headline: Ranji Trophy: Padikkal named Karnataka captain, KL Rahul returns for Punjab clash Devdutt Padikkal has replaced Mayank Agarwal as Karnataka's captain for their final league-stage Ranji Trophy match against Punjab.

Bangladesh's cricket crisis deepens with U19 World Cup exit after senior's T20 WC snub Bangladesh U19 have been knocked out of the U19 World Cup after England beat them by seven wickets in the Super Sixes match on Monday in Bulawayo. Earlier, the senior men's team was left out of the T20 World Cup with Scotland replacing them.

Shai Hope to lead as West Indies name strong squad for T20 World Cup The West Indies have named a strong 15-member squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026, with the two-time champions set to be led by Shai Hope at the ICC tournament.

Ishan Kishan's audacious intent receives big praise from R Ashwin: Different breed IND vs NZ: Ravichandran Ashwin praised Ishan Kishan's fearless batting after his rapid 28 off 13 balls against New Zealand, saying the left-hander's audacity and confidence showed a different breed of cricketer.

RCB vs MI LIVE Score: Nat Sciver-Brunt into the 90s, 5 runs away from history Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) vs Mumbai Indians (MI), WPL 2026 Live Updates: Bengaluru have won the toss and opted to bowl first. Nicola Carey has been left out while Amelia Kerr has returned for Mumbai. Bengaluru have a chance of qualifying for the final, while Mumbai are looking to earn a crucial win and enter the top three.

Sabalenka, Alcaraz headline star-studded quarterfinal lineup Australian Open: Aryna Sabalenka, Iga Swiatek, Carlos Alcaraz, Jannik Sinner and several other top contenders will be chasing places in the semifinals when they take the court in their respective quarterfinal matches.

India wanted Bangladesh in T20 World Cup but Pakistan misled them: Rajeev Shukla BCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla accused Pakistan of instigating Bangladesh after it refused to play T20 World Cup 2026 matches in India, leading to ICC rejecting venue changes and Scotland replacing Bangladesh.

Pakistan delay final call on T20 World Cup participation after PCB chief meets Pak PM The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has delayed a final decision on the country's participation in the T20 World Cup after chairman Mohsin Naqvi met Prime Minister Muhammad Shehbaz Sharif.

Tilak Varma is a big-match player, knock vs Pakistan was unbelievable: Rohit Sharma Tilak Varma has firmly established himself as a big-match player, delivering consistent performances for Mumbai Indians and India, including a match-winning 69* in the Asia Cup 2025 final against Pakistan.

Don Bradman's Australia Baggy Green fetches whopping 460,000 dollars in auction Sir Donald Bradman's rare Baggy Green cap from the 1947–48 season sold for a record 460,000 dollars at auction, underscoring the enduring legacy and unmatched cultural value of cricket's greatest icon.

After ICC warning, Pakistan consider forfeiting India game at T20 World Cup: Report T20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan are reportedly weighing its options to protest against the ICC, which includes forfeiting its game against India. This comes after the ICC's decision to not change the venues of Bangladesh's fixtures in the tournament.

Bihar thrash Manipur by 568 runs to secure Ranji Trophy Elite Group promotionBihar rode on opener Piyush Singh's outstanding second-innings double century to thrash Manipur by 568 runs in the Plate final on Monday, sealing their return to the Ranji Trophy Elite Group.

Iga Swiatek emulates Serena Williams, youngest in 23 years to reach major landmarkAustralian Open: World No.2 Iga Swiatek beat Maddison Inglis on Sunday at the Rod Laver Arena and advanced to the quarterfinals where she will lock horns with Elena Rybakina.

Sinner beats fellow Italian to storm into quarters after tracker controversyWorld number two Jannik Sinner was dominant in the shorter exchanges as he defeated Italian compatriot Luciano Darderi 6-1, 6-3, 7-6 (2) to book his place in the Australian Open quarter-finals.

Australian Open: Yuki Bhambri's exit brings down curtains on India's challengeYuki Bhambri and Andre Goransson were eliminated in the third round of Australian Open men's doubles. Their defeat ends India's participation in this year's Grand Slam tournament and raises concerns for Indian tennis prospects.

IND vs NZ: Tilak Varma to miss last two T20Is as BCCI makes T20 World Cup callIND vs NZ: Tilak Varma has been ruled out of the last two T20Is of the ongoing series against New Zealand as he continues his recovery from abdomen injury. Varma will link up with the Indian squad on February 3 ahead of their first warm-up fixture of the T20 World Cup 2026.

Spring in the bat? Why New Zealand players inspected Abhishek Sharma's batIndia vs New Zealand, 3rd T20I: A video of New Zealand players checking Abhishek Sharma's bat after his 14-ball fifty went viral. The opener tore into the Black Caps' attack, powering India's 154-run chase in just 10 overs on Sunday.

Australian legend claims he was abused, forced to delete post on BangladeshFormer Australia cricketer Jason Gillespie faced online abuse after questioning ICC over Bangladesh's removal from the 2026 T20 World Cup. Bangladesh were removed from World Cup after refusing to travel to India, citing security concerns.

World Cup 2003 flashback as Sourav Ganguly stumbles in another South African finalTwenty-three years after leading India in the 2003 World Cup final defeat, Sourav Ganguly suffered another South Africa final heartbreak as coach of Pretoria Capitals in the SA20 title clash on Sunday. The Capitals lost to SunRisers Eastern Cape despite a hundred from Dewald Brevis.

Lorenzo Musetti downs Fritz, Anisimova marches into quarter-finalsFifth seed Lorenzo Musetti reached the Australian Open quarter-finals for the first time with a composed 6-2, 7-5, 6-4 win over American Taylor Fritz at Rod Laver Arena. Amanda Anisimova also advanced, beating China's unseeded Wang Xinyu to book a quarter-final meeting with fellow American Jessica Pegula.

If Pakistan don't play T20 World Cup, broadcasters will go bankrupt: Ex cricketerBasit Ali warns Pakistan's withdrawal from the 2026 T20 World Cup could cause major losses for broadcasters. The PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi call for government clearance adds uncertainty to Pakistan's participation amid ICC's threat of sanctions.

Michael Carrick plays down permanent Manchester United job talk after Arsenal winMichael Carrick has played down talk of becoming Manchester United's permanent manager, choosing to focus on the present as United's revival gathers pace after statement wins over Arsenal and Manchester City.

India will thrash you: Pakistan warned to skip T20 World Cup, save embarrassmentIndia vs New Zealand: Former India captain Kris Srikkanth jokingly urged Pakistan to skip the T20 World Cup to avoid the embarrassment of being hammered by India. The 1983 World Cup winner said most teams would be scared of facing an Indian side in belligerent batting form during the ongoing T20I series against New Zealand.

The Shakib card: Did Bangladesh pull a stunt to mask T20 World Cup embarrassment?The Bangladesh Cricket Board has confirmed that Shakib Al Hasan is eligible to play for the national team. But the question remains: did the BCB make this decision purely to give Shakib a platform to bow out of international cricket, or is there a different motive behind it?

Drop Sanju Samson? Ishan Kishan piles pressure on Kerala star: Ex-bowlerIshan Kishan's powerful innings puts Sanju Samson under pressure in India's T20I squad, feels former New Zealand bowler Simon Doull. The team faces a tough selection choice with Tilak Varma's return adding to the competition.

Indian sport has a big problem: An unsporting bureaucracyIndian sportspersons are not held back by a lack of talent or ambition, but by a bureaucracy that too often humiliates those it should protect. Until athletes are treated with dignity and governance learns accountability, Olympic ambition will remain hollow, and every medal will carry the weight of what athletes endured to win it.

Australian Open: Madison Keys' title defence ends after 4th round loss to PegulaJessica Pegula ended Madison Keys' Australian Open campaign with a straight-sets win over the defending champion at the Rod Laver Arena. Pegula will next face Amanda Anisimova or Wang Xinyu in the quarter final.

Abhishek Sharma is ready for ODIs, time to unleash the Hitman heirAbhishek Sharma's explosive batting, spin bowling, and aggression against pacers give India a solid option for the ODI World Cup in South Africa

IND vs NZ: Sanju Samson told not to bat like Abhishek Sharma after hattrick of failuresAjinkya Rahane urged Sanju Samson to play his natural game amid poor form, saying he shouldn't copy Abhishek Sharma after his poor form continued during the Guwahati T20I against New Zealand on Sunday, January 25.

Supercalifragilisticfantabulous: Gavaskar speechless after India's Guwahati dominanceSunil Gavaskar was left searching for words after India's ruthless win in Guwahati, hailing a champion side as Abhishek Sharma's record knock sealed another dominant display against New Zealand.

IND vs NZ, 3rd T20I: Ravi Bishnoi reflects on the hard road back to India's T20I sideAfter a testing year away from the national side, Ravi Bishnoi returned to India's T20I setup with a composed performance against New Zealand, underlining how patience, domestic grind and technical correction shaped his comeback.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
